title: geust09
author: geust09
content: Hey there. Uhm, I haven't posted in a while, and I want to say I think that Cryptos will probably be a Hollywood refund and not free money.-There's also a difference between the two, as free money would have been more promising as the other is not, and that's funny and bogus and laughable.-In light of the recent pump in Dogecoin, trying to decide when to return is only a cold shoulder to the community in the future because it was a Hollywood refund. -Opinion.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: geust09 on July 21, 2023, 03:21:12 AMIn light of the recent pump in DogecoinThat looks more like a dead cat bounce than a pump. A real pump is what happened in April and ended just as abruptly too when price reached 360+ satoshi (50%) or in November last year from 310 to 760 (145%). Any pump now should be going back to above 300 sat at least, not what happened past week with a tiny rise from 213 to 240 satoshi (12%).I also have no clue what any of this have to do with Hollywood!

comments.author: raidarksword
comments.body: I cannot relate the hollywon context of you post here though crypto is doing good lately as the market is on a good trend right now despite the bear seasons we have, bitcoin still managed to hang tight on $30k. Pump is not here yet, we are still in accumulation mode and true pump action will be 2024 - 2025 wherein it's the time for halving events which triggers a good uptrend in the market.

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: The question is,  what do people refer to as free money and to think of it that there is free money in cryptocurrency is becoming a big fallacy that many of us are becoming tired to hear because no one can own money unless their work for it or in some form of charity otherwise any other form of free money distribution is fake and attempt bigger scam to come. Movie streaming is as old as video editing and filmmaking itself,  and at that,  if cryptocurrencies are included as revenue allocation to content creators and movie makers,  it then means that the movie industry will become a major adopter of cryptocurrency aside gambling industry is also a major market for cryptocurrency.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: I am having a hard time understanding exactly what you are asking? I am assuming you want Paramount pictures or some other large Hollywood company to make a Bitcoin movie to pump the price.I don’t think it will make a difference because people already know what Bitcoin is. It made a difference 10 years ago with Mr Robot and The Good Wife episodes because it was new back then. Now it won’t pump bitcoins price if some big movie was released.

comments.author: Sebas.tian
comments.body: I don't think there is a free money in cryptocurrency, and that is what made it different from fiat money, so you have to work for it , for you to be able to earn well when time come. If you are working in an organizations, I think it will be easy for you to save your salary so that you can invest in any potential altcoins in the market, because their price has decreased to allow you to buy as much as you want and hodl for the price to increase higher before you can release for sale to make a passive income. Well, based on the recent moved of dogecoin price in the market show that you will achieve something good in the future, if you can embrace the opportunity in this period by investing huge amount of money on it, because the price is preparing to increase higher before the end of this month of July.

comments.author: rhomelmabini
comments.body: It's cryptic or just out of context. Probably OP is sending some hints or something or not on his state of mind when he posted this. Well, Bitcoin is not a free money at all to begin with, even with the start of the Bitcoin genesis those who mine it will probably have paid something on it e.g. electricity at least, the hardwares being used. Dogecoin and Hollywood refund seems not aligning at all.
